books.title: The Communist Manifesto
books.author: Karl Marx
books.summary: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels’ classic analysis of modern industrial society and call for Working Class revolution.

books.title: The Sea Hawk
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A Cornish gentleman becomes a Barbary corsair and seeks vengeance on the jealous half brother who betrayed him.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Heidi
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A small girl is left with her grandfather and falls in love with his alpine home.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: The Taming of the Shrew
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: An unmarriageable shrew receives a marriage proposal.

books.title: The Blazing World
books.author: Margaret Cavendish
books.summary: A young lady is abducted and finds herself the empress of a strange new world.

books.title: Marius the Epicurean
books.author: Walter Pater
books.summary: A young man in the second-century Roman empire explores philosophy and religion as he travels through life.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: Clouds of Witness
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An aristocrat with a passion for detective work has to clear the Duke, his brother, from a charge of murder.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Tusculan Disputations
books.author: Cicero
books.summary: Cicero gives practical guidance for living wisely and well by adopting a Stoic outlook and concentrating on the virtues.

books.title: Cane
books.author: Jean Toomer
books.summary: An experimental and highly lyrical novel exploring the African-American experience.

books.title: The Works of Max Beerbohm
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A collection of satirical essays ridiculing pretentiousness through imitation.

books.title: Star Born
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: Two human protagonists find themselves on opposite sides of an inter-species war.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A collection of science fiction stories by Frederik Pohl ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Practical Mysticism
books.author: Evelyn Underhill
books.summary: Evelyn Underhill makes the case that mysticism is accessible and beneficial to everyone.

books.title: Two Years Before the Mast
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A Harvard student embarks on a two-year voyage as a sailor aboard a merchant ship, exposing the harsh conditions of life at sea in the 19th century.
